The incumbent is also responsible for projects resource scheduling, tracking, risk management and quality assurance. Responsibilities: Project & Service Management Lead, deliver and maintain projects within time, scope and cost Ensure project delivery quality Plan & establish project schedules, quality plans, budgets, and communication and risk management plans Manage issues arising out of scope definition and disputes that impacted scope, schedule and cost Manage issues arising from integration of various components of the project, e.g. hardware, software installation, testing, business process review, redesign, application development, migration and data conversion etc Manage project financials, ensuring project cost/ revenue forecast is done accurately Oversee the implementation of the project with regard to schedules, budget, manpower and quality Resolve project overrun issues Track project progress and report to Senior Management and Customer Manage resources in terms of mobilising resources during different periods of time from team to team to maximise productivity or minimise wastage Lead the project and service team on smooth project transition to operation in accordance to customer requirement and processes. Manage project operation and ensure service level is maintained without financial penalty and security incident due to negligent or lack of awareness Customer/Vendor/ Stakeholder Management Manage contracts and subcontractors Effectively engaged stakeholders in project decisions and execution Build long-term customer relationships by anticipating and exceeding customer's expectation Negotiate with customers on change control mechanism to meet schedules and prioritize changes based on business needs Strong customer-service orientation Team Management Work cohesively, lead, guide, manage and motivate the projects' team members in delivering quality project works, eliminating project exceptions and delighting the customers Plan for optimal use of resources across teams comprising of Project and Technical competencies Manage performance review of team and maintain open communication with team for feedback on continuous improvement Ensure high individual and staff billability The ideal profile should have / be: Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent More than 8 years of project management experience Self-motivated with a positive "can-do" attitude, creative with excellent presentation, communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills including strong persuasive techniques Able to lead, develop and maintain respectful and trusting relationship Able to travel as and when required Proven track record in assuming overall responsibilities and managing large scale projects

Possess demonstrable skills in customer-centric selling and a proven track record using it to help drive revenue Participate as a technical resource at trade shows and conferences Work independently and as a vital member of a sales team Work with the sales team to strategize on sales approaches to develop business Ensure successful on-site and remote product evaluations (POCs) and post-sale installations when necessary The ideal candidate should possess: 3 - 5 years of experience working in a pre-sales capacity related to at least two of the following core domains: Network Security, Endpoint Security, Security Consulting, Incident Response, SIEM, Threat Detection and Managed Security solutions. 5 years experience in SIEM/SOC/Threat Dedection, Managed Security Solutions include GRC Familiar with regularity compliance like IM8, AIAS, CSA Security by Design, MAS TRM Strong technical skills with the ability to prioritize and execute in a methodical and disciplined manner. Set and manage expectations with senior stakeholders and team members Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to present to a variety of external audiences, including being able to interact with senior executives History of creating rapport with customers, from line technicians to line and mid-level managers. English: Fluent Previous technical enablement or training experience. Hands-on experience with Intrusion Detection Systems, Security Information Event Management solutions, packet analysis tools and operating system analysis. Excellent knowledge of security solutions and technologies, including: Linux, Network architecture/implementation/configuration experience Knowledge of packet flow/TCP/UDP traffic Firewall technologies, proxy technologies, anti-virus, spam and spyware solutions (Gateway and SaaS) Malware/security experience Understand and be conversant about Cyber Security Domains Ability to lead as a Delivery Architect during the project implementation Ideally, you'll also have Bachelor's Degree or equivalent educational or industry experience Professional security related qualification (i.e. CISA, CISM, CISSP, GCIA etc.) will be an advantage (can this replace the above point, as this is what I indicate in SA JD)

Job_Descriptions: Responsible for the pro-active management of a portfolio of Banks and Non-bank Financial Institutions in China, Hong Kong and Macau by providing credit facilities to support OCBC Bank's trading/treasury operations. Work with different Business Units (such as Global Financial Institutions, Global Treasury) to structure credit facilities that mitigate the credit risks inherent in derivatives and other trading floor / treasury business products. These would include the Group's subsidiaries. Co-ordinate the submission of accurate and timely credit reviews. Recommend changes to risk acceptance criteria, if necessary. Be well-versed with the Bank's credit policies and procedures and recommend credit policy changes, as required. Participate in the development of risk management standards, procedures and processes for new trading floor business products and structures. Ensure new transactions and credit renewals meet OCBC's risk acceptance criteria, credit policies and procedures and regulatory requirements. Work in partnership with dealers/traders to understand business requirements and structure credit facilities to meet those specifications. Respond quickly and professionally to requests from the trading floor for credit authorizations. Negotiate credit terms of ISDA/CSA, GMRA and GMSLA. Lead, guide and mentor junior credit analysts. Assess and approve credit propositions, review and transactions submitted by Business Units in a timely manner. The BUs include Capital Markets, Financial Institutions, Global Trade Finance and Global Treasury. Qualifications Candidate should possess a good degree from a recognized university. At least 8-10 years of relevant credit experience. Strong knowledge of, and experience in, credit analysis as well as treasury products. Sophisticated analytical skills including extensive experience in analyzing financial statements in order to assess credit risks. Strong team player, results-oriented and shows ability to adapt. Willingness and ability to express opinions and work in a demanding environment. Knowledge in ISDA/CSA, GMRA, GMSLA. Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills.

Responsibilities : • To lead a team of specialists in performing model validation of market risk models for the whole of the bank's Group covering both traded and non-traded models. The team's major responsibilities are as per listed below. • To conduct pre and post-implementation validation of derivatives and market risk models, in line with best practices, used in the Bank for pricing and risk management, including: - Assessing model inputs, model assumptions, market conventions, model theories, model limitations and mitigating factors. - Developing independent models for FX, IR, Credit, Equity and Commodity derivatives. - Developing automation tools for model validation activities. - Developing appropriate controls to mitigate for model risk and market uncertainty. • Identify sources of model risk by thoroughly and comprehensively review all model components and developmental evidence. • To engage with stakeholders (Market Risk, Front Office Quant / Structuring / Trading Teams) effectively and maintain productive working relationships. • To provide healthy challenge to model developers and ensure models approved are of highest standard. • To keep abreast with market and regulatory changes. To be aware of Regulators' requirements and ensure adherence. • To clearly and concisely communicate the model review results to the rest of the team, other functions and senior management. • To present and explain the validation results to the management committee for endorsement and approval. • Take ownership of the team's internal initiatives and projects and contribute to the various bank-wide projects that require quantitative technical expertise. • To manage the team which includes work planning and staff development. Requirements: • Advanced Degree (Masters or PhD) in Quantitative Discipline(Physics, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Engineering etc.) from recognized universities. • Experience leading a model development or validation team • Relevant experience in developing or validating quantitative pricing and risk models in traded market risk. Other strong analytical and quantitative analysis experience will be considered. • Familiar with stochastic modelling techniques. Analytical skills, knowledge of mathematical models, stochastic calculus, Monte Carlo simulation and PDE modelling are required. Experience in IBOR Transition/OIS curve construction will be an added advantage. • Good understanding of the trading & treasury business (across all asset classes) and models;and good understanding of the regulatory framework. • Self-motivated person with a high level of drive, dedication and desire to excel consistently. • Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills. • Meticulous, organised and self-assured with ability to interact well with various working levels. • Advanced programming skills in C++, Mathlab, VBA, R, Python etc. ONLY SHORTLISTED CANDIDATES WILL BE NOTIFIED.

Job_Title: Global Transaction Services Techno Senior Business Analyst
Job_Descriptions: Global Transaction Services Techno Senior Business Analyst The role will be part of the Global Transaction Services Technology (GTST) APAC team. GTST is a technology service delivery organization supporting the Global Banking and Markets business in Asia Pacific. The Bank is embarking on a multi-year core banking transformation journey to replace its legacy core banking platform with modern technology platforms. As part of the core banking platform transformation, the bank will seek opportunities to revamp & improve its end to end ecosystem to improve operational & technological efficiency. The core banking platforms support multiple functions in Global Banking and Markets business: e.g. payments, deposits, credit, trade finance, foreign exchange, general ledger. The candidate will be a senior product and techno-functional expert, and will play a leadership role in the banking transformation program. He/She will work with product teams, technical leads, and vendor SMEs for a given work stream (e.g. payments, trade finance) under the core banking transformation program and will have direct accountability in ensuring that business requirements for the work stream are designed and implemented as per expectation. The role is expected to build a deep understanding of the core banking platform and the capability it offers, and play a leadership role in solution ideation, design, and delivery. The role is required to work closely with business, operations, vendor partners and various peer groups/stakeholders in technology. The Position: Work with business, operations, and technology teams to gather requirements and recommend the optimal way to implement the solution in the product. Organize/Facilitate vendor demos to evaluate tools and solutions that may be adopted. Provide leadership and guidance on functional and technical aspects of the solution. Leverage domain and product expertise to set direction and drive project execution. Foresee and proactively address risks, issues, and dependencies. Act as the liaison between vendor and internal teams on requirements and oversee their end-to-end implementation. Manage user queries during feature implementation, and ensure that they are tracked and closed. Participate in system design, SIT, and UAT to ensure that solutions are being delivered and tested as per requirements. Ensure knowledge sharing and training on new product features. Recommend and implement data migration and integration strategies. Develop the Day-1 Operating model and support its implementation post go live. The Candidate: Essential Skills (Technical / Business Domain / Managerial/ Soft skills) Sound knowledge of the Wholesale Banking domain: e.g. deposits, payments, receivables, liquidity management, trade finance, commercial loans, credit management, FX. Experience in Core Banking transformation, and in designing core banking solutions that fit into a complex product ecosystem. Experience working with product and service vendors, and with the onshore-offshore delivery model. Ability to drive senior level discussions with good presentation and communication skills. Ability to influence & work with regional and global partners/stakeholders to drive the program forward. Execution and result oriented. Aptitude for critical thinking, problem solving, and decision-making. Desired Skills (Technical / Domain / Managerial/ Language Skills) Finacle implementation expertise. Knowledge of Finacle Core modules and the Finacle data model. Knowledge of Finacle Scripting and Finacle Workflows. Familiarity with Asia Banking market practices For more information you can email Duncan Gage in our Singapore office on Duncan.gage@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 523619 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/96S9x4/global-transaction-services-techno-senior-business-analyst-itcommunications-singapore-singapore-14463422 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA Licence No. 10C4544

Job_Title: Deputy Director / Assistant Director, Records Management (EKD)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator. As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector. As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education. MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry. Join us now, if have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape. What you will be working on We are looking for a passionate and talented Records Management Specialist to join our dynamic team that drives records management (RM) in MAS. In this position, you will be part of the Library and Records Division (LRD) and will work with the Chief Records Officer (CRO) to ensure that MAS records are properly managed and easily accessible for day-to-day business functions as well as for future reference. You are expected to contribute to all MAS RM initiatives such as to curate records on thematic policy history of the authority, and to drive significant improvements to RM processes through digital transformation. Formulate, implement and review policies, procedures and guidelines for records-related aspects of MAS’ Knowledge Policy i.e. from records creation, storage and preservation through to disposal. Plan and roll out initiatives on RM-related functions, such as: o Raise awareness of responsibilities, good principles, and best practices in RM. o Facilitate and conduct training for MAS officers on RM responsibilities and procedures. o Work with MAS departments to develop file plan as well as to determine retention schedules and disposition action for records not in National Archives of Singapore (NAS)’s appraised schedules. o Work with MAS departments to facilitate digitisation of records, and ensuring that records are archived/transferred to NAS or destroyed according to NAS’ approved appraisal schedules. o Participate in declassification and curation of records to showcase MAS’ policy history. Liaise with the NAS for RM-related functions, e.g. appraisal of retention schedule, transfer of records, and conducting self-assessment of RM in MAS. Assist CRO to ensure that MAS complies with relevant whole of government, legal and business requirements in RM. Lead initiatives/projects that transform work processes, systems and records storage/archival as well as subsequent disposition action such as transfer of records to NAS or destruction of records. What we are looking for 5 to 10 years of relevant experience in records management. Good understanding of IM4L, IM8 and ISD's green book; experience in working with IM4L compliance will be an advantage. Must be tech savvy with prior experience in product management preferred i.e. be able to translate business requirements into technical specifications for implementation. Prior experience in user needs analysis, design thinking, business process reviews, knowledge/information management and change management will be an advantage. Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills, with ability to engage and manage stakeholders at all levels of the organisation. Strong communication and writing skills. Able to design simple communication collaterals (e.g. EDMs). Meticulous; Metrics-driven with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Able to work independently and multitask on projects, priorities, and deliverables. Proactive and self-motivated; has strong drive and thrives in a fast-paced, high volume environment. Committed and confident team player who collaborates with people from various teams, sharing knowledge and best practice, as well as work across teams to deliver results. You will be working in a fast-paced environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and needs of stakeholders, as well as the agility to respond to changes and developments. As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment. All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Job_Title: Deputy Director/ Assistant Director/Associate, Manpower Development Division
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator. As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector. As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education. MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry. Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape What you will be working on You will be part of a dynamic team tasked to build a world-class financial sector workforce with a strong local core. You will have the opportunity to gain a deep understanding of the national priority of jobs and skills for our people, and contextualising it to the financial sector to develop and execute meaningful strategies. This include developing job ready graduates, building specialist skillsets, grooming local leaders, and fostering workforce transformation. Even as we focus our efforts on enhancing the competitiveness of our local workforce, we continue to develop creative strategies to attract foreign expertise with complementary skillsets and networks to build new businesses and capabilities to further the development of Singapore as an international financial centre, which will in turn create good jobs for our people. Our work is driven by data to shape policies and design programmes, and executed through close collaboration with tripartite partners, including the industry, other government agencies and the labour movement. As a member of the Global Talent team, you will be responsible for policy formulation, framework design and operational implementation of manpower policies that are supportive of the development of Singapore as an international financial centre. You will have the opportunity to work with data and with both internal and external stakeholders on safeguarding Singapore’s attractiveness for global talent to build new capabilities and anchor new businesses in the financial services industry. What we are looking for At least 3 to 4 years of working experience preferred Strong public service spirit and effective team player Strong analytical and policy thinking skills with good understanding of macroeconomic and financial issues Good communication skills Applicants should be Singapore citizens. All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Job_Title: Senior Manager/Manager (Workplace Development/Data and Digitalisation Unit)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The National Council of Social Service is the co-ordinating body for more than 400 social service organisations in Singapore. The Council provides leadership and direction in social services, enhances the capabilities of social service organisations, and promotes strategic partnerships across the people, public and private sectors. The Workplace Development team, alongside other critical functions within CDCG, plays a vital role in addressing how NCSS as an organisation functions, transforms and responds to external trends. D&D, within Workplace Development, is a relatively new unit setup to drive towards a forward-looking One NCSS that is digital-capable, agile and data-driven. It serves to plan, spearhead, develop and coordinate data and digitalisation initiatives across different divisions and workgroups. The role will also involve alignment of work around data governance and strategy, both internally, with our parent ministry MSF, and with Whole-Of-Government’s Government Data Architecture. What you will be working on As an intrapreneur, you will dream, plan, rationalise, coordinate, and spearhead the strategy around data and digitalisation. You get to define what we want to achieve as #OneNCSS. Giving up is not an option and answers will not be readily available from the textbooks. As an advocate, your ability to engage the different groups and levels to seek buy in, drive the data and digital strategies, identify business value, and develop implementation roadmaps will be crucial. Ability to find common ground and reconcile differences to achieve common goals will serve you well. As a connector, you will need to be sensitive to linkages and opportunities to mobilise and broker between stakeholders. Results will not come easy as change is never easy, but when we get there, the transformational work done will be sweet and fulfilling. What we are looking for Personal Competencies / Traits: Systematic & Organised People-centric Meticulous with an eye for detail Strong interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills Speed in delivering is your second nature Swimming in unchartered waters excites you Adaptable, ready to work hard, analyse learnings and be iterative Enthusiasm to experiment with new ideas while managing risks and mitigating the potential impact of change Ability to follow through, work independently as well as in a team Self-motivated and with a high level of initiative Willingness to push boundaries Excitement in overcoming challenges Strong analytical and conceptual skills with capacity to plan and think strategically and innovatively Keen interest in data and digital technologies Skills & Knowledge: Good understanding and appreciation for the possibilities of data and digitalisation Thirst for innovation and ability to work and synthesize with different ideas. Strong in project management and people engagements Good understanding of institutional knowledge to smell potential, possibilities and constraints. Change management experience and involvement in transformation projects would be a plus Experience with formulation and execution of data strategy and its management would be an advantage. Experience: At least 5 years work experience, preferably with involvement in projects relating to transformation, innovation, change management, and development of supporting structures to translate vision to reality. Familiarity with nature of NCSS work would be an advantage.

Talent Management Specialist (1 year Contract) At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! BRIEF Seeking new opportunities to make an impact in the learning and talent management space? Bank of Singapore is searching for a dynamic and innovative Talent Specialist to advance our leadership & high potential initiatives to greater heights. Bank of Singapore is a staunch believer in learning and talent management. Our People agenda rank high in our strategic priorities and we take extreme care to ensure our staff gets best-in-class learning. Our learning mission is to bring personalized, practical and panoramic learning experiences to our staff. We love to help ordinary people become EXTRAORDINARY! The learning and talent management team comprises of a group of vivacious learning professionals who are passionate about People Development. We think, dream, talk, persuade & inspire growth to those around us. We embrace an inquisitive mind to look out for new ideas, innovations and trends so as to bring cutting-edge as well as forward-looking training programs to the organisation. We thrive when we live out of the box and push the envelope to break new grounds. The fruit of our labour is a home-grown curriculum built with humble commitment and a strong sense of purpose to see others succeed. Besides, this hard work also yielded the 2021 HRM Silver Award in Learning & Development If these descriptions resonate with you, call out to us and be part of an exciting growth story to re-imagine the way we learn. Bank of Singapore: Asia's global private bank - Rooted in Asia, Global in Perspectives. We are the wholly-owned private banking arm of OCBC Bank. With over 2,000 staff, including 400 private bankers of over 32 different nationalities, we are committed to serving high net-worth clients across geographies, especially in our key markets of Asia and the Middle East. Our Employer Promise: "Here in Bank of Singapore, we promise to build a Caring and Progressive community to achieve your aspirations. We seek to Deliver a Difference by embracing new thinking and celebrating your successes, in big and also small ways" WHAT WILL YOU DO Organise and schedule division-wide Talent Briefing Sessions Prepare, collate and assemble data to enhance fact-based decision-making during talent review Up-keep talent database/dashboard and update of excel/PowerPoint templates post talent review Support systems enhancement, maintenance and upkeeping of information in the talent system Work on team presentation decks Support Young/Digital Talent Initiatives and bank-wide push on our digital journey upskilling efforts Drive programs take-up through marketing campaigns (SharePoint, EDMs, Course Brochures, Facebook, CSOD Communities, Quizzes and Trivias) Support leadership development initiatives, reporting and upkeep of leadership dashboard Coordinate Mentoring Series and check in sessions with mentors/mentees Support the program managers in any other initiatives (program development, facilitation, Qualtrics surveys, training funding) Research & provide basic data insights during ideation sessions Set up training form for Learn experience team to create event and session in LMS Send calendar invite to participants/internal speakers Upkeep training deck/records Prepare and update attendance list pre and post training for internal/external trainers Coordinate with trainers to ensure seamless setup of all virtual/face-to-face training Uphold L&T brand and vision across all touchpoints Qualifications THE KEYS TO YOUR SUCCESS: Embrace a can-do spirit and roll up your sleeves to make things happen Meticulous, having an eye for details Effective time management Be resilience. When the going gets tough, dig in and push through with continued excellence Think out of the box and seek alternate knowledge and resources to deliver Factor the possible implications with every action taken and make the best decisions Proficient in excel and PowerPoint Knowledge in PowerBI and or macro/programming tools would be a bonus

Job_Title: APAC Risk Management Legal Entity Oversight Coordinator - Senior Vice President
Job_Descriptions: Job Background/Context: The APAC Chief Risk Officer (APAC CRO) is responsible for managing Citi’s risk from a regional dimension with oversight of all the risks in Asia across Consumer, Commercial, ICG, and the Private Bank. The APAC CRO provides prudential supervision and strategic direction for the entire Independent Risk Management organization in Asia to ensure active identification and management of emerging and existing risks. The APAC CRO also has primary interface responsibilities with the various regulators across Asia and is a key partner to the APAC CEO. The APAC Risk Management Legal Entity Oversight Coordinator role provides unique visibility and exposure to different countries, businesses, functions, products, and risk types. The candidate will have significant interaction with the APAC CRO, Citi’s senior management, and subject matter experts as well as direct responsibility for one of the most critical strategic projects for Citi in the region. Responsibilities Include: Key responsibilities are as follows. Establish and ongoing oversight of Legal Entity Risk Management Frameworks (RMF), Policy, Standards and Procedures in line with minimum baseline standards and local regulatory requirements for all applicable entities in APAC Establish and ongoing oversight of the Legal Entity Risk Appetite Framework (RAF), Policy, and Standards in line with minimum baseline standards for all applicable legal entities in APAC Ensure that dispensations are sought where minimum standards are not being met Oversee implementation of Risk Management Information (MI) tools Monitor and report all relevant risk categories and types against appetites set to the relevant committees and/or boards within the region in a timely fashion Perform gap analysis of Legal Entity capabilities against the baseline standards for RMF, RAF and MI for all applicable entities in APAC Establish the necessary remediation plans to ensure a path to green including any interim risk mitigation controls that may be required Participate in Risk MI tool development through the provision of detailed requirements to the development team, participation in UAT, gap analysis and remediation through to go-live in production Transition development of Legal Entity RMF, Legal Entity RAF, and MI to a BAU process including establishing any required annual review process for legal entities Engage with regional peers and central resources on ongoing development to ensure globally consistent approach for any required enhancements of Legal Entity capabilities Participate in Legal Entity tiering discussions (for relevant Legal Entities) including proposals to change tiers, ensuring implications are fully considered and appropriate steps are taken to meet minimum baseline standards Provide strategic analytics and information management to senior management. Responsible for communicating implications of existing Legal Entity-related regulations and developing potential responses Analyze new risk-related guidelines, best practice standards, rules and regulations. Provide updates, as needed, to management and regulators on exam and issue remediation status including progress against milestones, risk identified and any other potential impacts Significant interaction with a wide range of senior bank and risk management colleagues, as well as external stakeholders such as regulators / auditors Initiate feedback sessions with global and legal entity teams; leverage feedback to influence change throughout organization Manage regulatory or Internal Audit examinations related to legal entities to achieve full compliance Appropriately assess risk when decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards Experience and Qualifications: Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred 10+ years Risk experience in a global organization, with experience in product program governance and risk management frameworks Strong knowledge of multiple risk categories spanning Financial (e.g., Market, Credit, Liquidity) and Non-Financial (e.g., Operational, Compliance, Reputation and Strategic) Strong awareness of both bank (including Branch network) and broker dealer chains and their respective strategies, products, risk profiles and regulatory requirements in a global marketplace Knowledge of applicable Citi frameworks, policies, and standards Broad understanding of classifiable and delinquency managed credit and operational policies and procedures; ability to interpret financial and risk reporting Familiarity with regulatory landscape facing global banks; previous experience in managing regulatory inspections and audits Demonstrated ability to effectively partner with key constituents and stakeholders Demonstrated direct and indirect influence abilities Experience in producing reports and presentations for senior audiences and stakeholders Demonstrated ability to distill technical concepts and results into intuitive, impactful, and easily digested messages for senior management, auditors, and regulators Project management experience with proven ability to develop project plans and drive a diverse group of stakeholders to achieve milestones and deadlines Experience with issue resolution including root cause analysis, mitigation plans, and remediation activities Expert knowledge of Citi products, risk processes, and controls with good understanding of regulatory requirements and risk management Attributes Demonstrates strong ethics and integrity Demonstrated ability to effectively voice and defend independent views and handle conflict Excellent interpersonal and communication skills for interaction with senior management and regulators Demonstrated ability to effectively navigate organizational complexity, break silos and build partnerships across functional and business peers Experienced in partnering with global peers to leverage and implement best practices Makes decisions using well-reasoned judgment under pressure and in a timely manner; identifies and assesses alternatives as part of the decision-making process Ability to adapt and perform well under pressure and through rapidly developing situations Strong ability to influence and initiate change ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Risk Management ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: Regulatory Risk ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi . Job Description - MTS, Manufacturing Ops (22000624) About GLOBALFOUNDRIES GLOBALFOUNDRIES is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GLOBALFOUNDRIES makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. GLOBALFOUNDRIES is owned by Mubadala Investment Company. For more information, visit www.globalfoundries.com. Introduction GLOBALFOUNDRIES Fab8 is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Operations Technical Leader to remotely support night shift factory Operations from Singapore (Singapore Day time). As the face of operations, you will provide leadership support to the night shift team as well as direct Operation steps to ensure KPIs are met. This highly visible position will require you to have strong analytical, problem solving, and communication skills to develop and execute the proper game plans. This position will be located at GLOBALFOUNDRIES in Singapore. Your Job Ensure a safe work environment and help build a culture where safety is the first priority Be an active leader in safety programs and help ensure compliance with EHS rules by visitors, contractors and employees at GLOBALFOUNDRIES Fab8 Shows mastery of the technical side of Operations and is recognized within the company as a senior member of the technical team. Coaches and mentors less experienced staff, influences others as a technical leader, and regularly provides specialized technical guidance to others in work area. Assist in leading a team of technicians and shift engineers providing day-to-day operations guidance and support for their specifically assigned module Provide engineering support for manufacturing operations to achieve the desired WIP turns and cycle time goals Proactively analyze and identify issues that could cause concern to Fab Performance / Delivery Actively initiate and drive work teams to improve the overall efficiency and performance of the department Coordinate with Manufacturing Engineering to review daily goals/priorities, project statuses, and qualification timelines. Relentlessly drive efficiencies and utilization Lead initiatives and support Fab8’s efforts in building a world class organization, achieving manufacturing excellence and establishing a team based collaborative culture. Required Qualifications: BS degree in Chemical, Electrical, Industrial, Mechanical Engineering, or a closely related physical science or engineering field of study Minimum seven years of experience in Semiconductor Manufacturing Operations Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills, energetic and self-starter Outstanding communication skills - both written and verbal Ability to communicate well with all levels of the organization and experience in working with external constituencies Strong organizational skills along with the ability to be the intermediary between a Shift team of engineers, process technicians and maintenance technicians Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and able to react to shifting priorities to meet business need Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and commitments Individuals will be and must be able to understand complex automated systems and human interactions. Individual must be well versed in all Microsoft and Google Applications (Excel, Sheets, Word, Docs, PowerPoint …). Familiarity with Fab 8’s manufacturing environment is preferred. GlobalFoundries is an equal opportunity employer, cultivating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We believe having a multicultural workplace enhances productivity, efficiency and innovation whilst our employees feel truly respected, valued and heard. As an affirmative employer, all qualified applicants are considered for employment regardless of age, ethnicity, marital status, citizenship, race, religion, political affiliation, gender, sexual orientation and medical and/or physical abilities. All offers of employment with GlobalFoundries are conditioned upon the successful completion of background checks, medical screenings as applicable and subject to the respective local laws and regulations. To ensure that we maintain a safe and healthy workplace for our GlobalFoundries employees, please note that offered candidates who have applied for jobs in Singapore will have to be fully vaccinated prior to their targeted start date. For new hires, the appointment is contingent upon the provision of a copy of their COVID-19 vaccination document, subject to any written request for medical or religious accommodation.

Job_Title: Real Estate Procurement and Cost Director (Stationed in Cambodia)
Job_Descriptions: JOB DESCRIPTION Our client is actively searching for a Director (Costing and Contracts) to join their team! If you are a dynamic individual seeking a new career opportunity, read further! The Director (Costing and Contracts) is a senior management position within the company and is instrumental to building the firm’s cost estimating and contracts related capabilities for a wide range of real estate property types/products in many local markets throughout Cambodia.  The Director (Costing and Contracts) heads the department of cost estimating, and contracts management professionals and supports multiple project teams beginning in the pre-acquisition phase and continuing through the pre-construction and construction phases. The responsibilities of this role are: Liaise with project team leaders regarding design development, budget development, scheduling and phasing, procurement planning and execution support. Develop and implement departmental policies, procedures, best practices and management tools that will contribute to building a scaleable team of professionals able to support the projects department group activities. Serve as the firm’s subject matter expert on design management and develop and maintain a database of technical and benchmark information that can be quickly accessed for the purposes of systems evaluation and selection, costing and general reference. Set departmental budgets, manpower planning and forecasting. Approve departmental expenditures. Liaise with senior management within the company and Cambodia on pertinent matters such as project progress, business planning, staffing, etc. Collaborate with Human Resources to help attract, train and retain top performing people in the firm. Mentor and coach team members through focused one-on-one engagements and written action plans. collaborate with the Core Team to establish group objectives and goals and help drive specific action plans to achieve these goals. Provide pre-acquisition phase support as requested by the P&D team and projects department lead, such as due diligence work, feasibility study, costing assumptions, etc. Functional Responsibilities: Costing Provide leadership in estimating and cost forecasting support to the project teams during the pre-development/acquisition, preconstruction and construction phases. Develop and maintain a comprehensive database of development (hard and soft costs).  Use the database to provide input and guidance to the project team in the group’s collective effort to develop commercially viable and competitive projects. Act as the firm’s primary point of contact and relationship manager for third party cost consultants. Lead the PROJECTS DEPARTMENT team in the development and refinement of project budgets and ensuring alliance with the program requirements and preliminary outline specifications. Provide a framework and database for facilitating value engineering services during the budget development, design development and procurement phases of the projects. Provide verification of the Bill of Quantities, technical specifications, budgeting and costing, and introduction of cost-effective items in support of the tender process. Identify areas of opportunity and risk in the sourcing and procurement of services and materials/equipment and develop and implement strategies to manage these issues; for example, minimization of taxation expense and commodity escalations risk. Contracts Develop and implement standard operating procedures and templates for the RFP/tendering and contract development phases. Work with PROJECTS DEPARTMENT team members immediately after site acquisition to formalize the procurement plan and lead the effort to develop and issue major RFPs/Tenders (for hard and soft costs). Liaise with clients, architects, consultants and internal stakeholders to manage and coordinate the procurement and contract development process. Conduct and manage the tender evaluations and leveling phase of the procurement process. Act as the single point of contact for all internal stakeholders and vendors in order to expedite the business process/workflow through the completion of fully executed agreements. Support the project team as requested in resolving additional services, claims, post contract issues and arbitration matters. Generally oversee and assist project team in the procurement and contract development phases as required and requested. The ideal candidate will need to have the following qualities and experience: Undergraduate or graduate degree in Quantity Surveying, Engineering, or Construction Management, or equivalent. Minimum fifteen (15) years significant experience as an estimator employed by a major building construction general contractor, construction manager, quantity surveyor, and/or developer, with specific focus on large scale mixed-use development projects; worked on at least one high-end and complex development project from design to construction with an area over 100,000 sqm. Strong project planning and management capabilities and the ability to create, implement, and monitor all construction schedules and control systems, policies, procedures, systems and standards. Demonstrated understanding of real estate market fundamentals at a country and local level, including benchmarking, service providers, typologies and project delivery methods. In-depth knowledge of prevailing market rates, trends, and standards as they relate to building materials and specifications of new building technologies. Expertise in tender evaluation, contract negotiations, and claims management and strategy. Sufficient working knowledge of FIDIC and British conditions of contract and rate analysis. Thorough understanding of contract issues, local import procedures and tax regulations, and the ability to collaborate with multiple internal stakeholders to resolve contract issues such as insurance, financial matters, taxation and legal matters. Working understanding of basic financial concepts and structures. An exciting career awaits the right candidate! Click "Quick Apply" to register your interest now. All applicants' CV will be treated with the strictest confidentiality. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We will try our best to reply all candidates within 7 working days.

The Company You’ll Join At Carta we create owners and make private markets liquid. We live in a world where some people live on the equity stack and enjoy exponential wealth growth and preferential tax treatment; others live on the debt stack and may work their entire lives for a company and retire only with the cash they’ve managed to save from their paychecks. Our contribution to solving the wealth inequality problem is moving people from the debt stack (payroll) to the equity stack. By making it as easy to issue equity to employees as it is to put them on payroll, we can create more owners. At Carta, we are helpful, transparent, fair, and kind. We are relentless executors, unconventional thinkers, and masters of our craft. Learn more about our Series G fundraising round here. The Team You’ll Work With Carta is looking for an Account Executive to join our Investor Services team in Singapore. Carta expanded to Singapore in 2021, and we are building a world-class team to support the startup ecosystem across Asia Pacific. The Singapore team is lean and agile, comprising of local venture industry experts and tenured Cartans. You will be part of a highly dynamic and diverse group of people who are responsible for every aspect of Carta’s growth across Asia. You will work closely with each member of our Singapore team, with a focus on sales. You will become an expert in private markets and venture capital operations. You will work closely with our Go-to-Market and Delivery Leads and learn key skills in sales development, deal making/negotiations, and client management. The Problems You’ll Solve Business Demand Generation Map and communicate the business impact of our product offerings to fund managers Demonstrating ability to manage influence through persuasion, negotiation, and consensus-building to identify and sell new opportunities Understand customer needs and requirements and act as a trusted business advisor Own the entire sales lifecycle, from lead generation to close Develop a comprehensive sales strategy and sales plan that ensures consistent achievement of goals over the short and long-term Customer and Partner Support Develop an in-depth understanding of the software platform and Carta IS fund services offering to support our clients across venture capital and growth equity funds, particularly in their fundraising process Support nurturing relationship with our channel partners, including but not limited to law firms and tax/audit advisors Data and Process Integrity & Maintenance Build and own sizable prospect and customer datasets in order to glean unique insights and drive desirable business outcomes Ensure data integrity across critical business systems (e.g. Salesforce, Outreach, Marketo, and Carta) Manage and schedule new business engagements cross functionally The Impact You’ll Have You will be part of a small team managing all commercial aspects of Carta’s growth in Asia. You will drive demand, develop and iterate on critical internal and outbound operations, and provide ongoing customer relationship support. You will be part of the inaugural team in Asia, helping build the infrastructure powering venture capital, private equity, and private companies About You Passionate about creating more equality in the world Relevant sales experience, preferably in a SaaS organization Experience managing a large pipeline Proven ability to execute, especially negotiation and closing contracts Articulate, poised, and concise Flexible, adaptable, and resilient - Comfortable working in a high velocity startup environment Competitive and driven to achieve goals Experience in professionally communicating with venture capitalists, finance executives, CEOs, and other high level executives Nice to have: Understands how venture fund services and operations help solve liquidity Understanding of fund operations / administration Understanding of venture capital & private equity as an asset class, and/or experience in institutional investing, and wealth management Carta is a Series G company and is backed by top-tier investors like EDBI, Silver Lake, Andreessen Horowitz, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Meritech Capital, and more. *Please note that we will be prioritizing candidates that are Singapore nationals / Permanent Residents, as we are not able to provide sponsorship for this role. Carta is a Series G company and is backed by top-tier investors like EDBI, Silver Lake, Andreessen Horowitz, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Meritech Capital, and more. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a positive interview experience for every candidate. If accommodations due to a disability or medical condition are needed, connect with us via email at **********@carta.com. As a company, we value fairness, helpfulness, transparency, leadership and build our teams around these values. Check out our careers page to get to know us better as you think about your next step at Carta.

Business Manager, Product Management Group At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! Bank of Singapore opens doors to new opportunities. Start your career with Bank of Singapore as a Business Manager, Product Management Group! ! Consulting Nature Analytics Solution Associate - Sustainability Qualifications Apply Now What You'll Work With You will be based in our Singapore office as part of our Sustainability Insights (SI) team. McKinsey has the goal of helping all industry sectors transform to get to net zero by 2050 and to cut carbon emissions by half by 2030 – with this in mind, we have launched McKinsey Sustainability, our new client-service platform. The planet’s natural assets are degraded at unprecedented scale and pace resulting in escalating impact on biodiversity, climate and ‘ecosystem services’. Leaders across private, public and social sectors are increasingly aware of the role they can play in halting the destruction of nature and natural capital and start restoring landscapes. McKinsey & Company supports government leaders, private sector CEOs and global non-profit alliances on this critically important topic especially in Asia and South East Asia, where the biggest nature-based solutions potential lies. McKinsey SI team is responsible for developing, maintaining and delivering models, data foundations and methodological approaches for our client service around topics like decarbonization, natural capital erosion and conservation, supply chain sustainability, climate change mitigation, carbon offset strategies, climate risk and the impacts of the energy transition. SI team support the climate and nature conservation strategy of private companies, NGOs and philanthropic entities and public-sector clients. As a member of the SI team, you will work closely with other team members, our global sustainability leadership and McKinsey colleagues across the globe with whom you will collaborate on client engagements. You will be directly responsible for analyses, insights and client support across sectors and geographies. You will create distinctive analytical assets as well as their deployment within clients’ contexts. Examples for product development tasks include building conservation plannig tools and creating metrics to evaluate the impact of client’s activities on climate or biodiversity. Examples for client service include supporting public sector clients on land use strategies or private sector clients on commodity-based supply chain mapping and spatial footprint reduction scenarios. You will have the opportunity to lead and contribute to impactful reach and relevance activities (e.g., publications on McKinsey.com or in the McKinsey Quarterly). You will conduct research and write detailed reports on specific sustainability-related topics using PowerPoint in direct client service. You will work on internal product development tasks and have extensive growth opportunities to specialize in particular areas of interest. Over time, you will take ownership over the development and growth of new capabilities within SI and you will develop into a world-class expert on specific perspectives, acting as a thought-partner to McKinsey senior leadership and clients. You will work alongside Sustainability Insights’ specialists, apply proprietary tools and methodologies and follow data-driven approaches to solve the most challenging sustainability problems our clients face today. What You'll Do Master's degree in a quantitative study in biology, geography, agronomy, climate or equivalent in geosciences; PhD level is preferred 2+ years of professional experience post master's degree; consulting experience is a plus Strong interest in global carbon cycle, conservation, natural capital, biodiversity, nature climate solutions and sustainability topics; expertise in those topics is a plus In-depth knowledge of environmental/conservation data and related analytical tools (e.g., species distribution models, linear programming, land use change models) Proficient in PowerPoint and Excel Advanced problem-solving skills; comfortable working with numbers/quantitative models Ambition to work in a fast-paced, result-oriented team and company with steep learning curve and strong commitment to coaching and development Enthusiasm to work in a start-up environment with agile digital product-development in a multi-cultural and multi-disciplinary team Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment (partial remote working models can be considered); ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization Strong people and communication skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Performance-driven balanced with proven success of working effectively in a cross-functional team in an international environment. Process-oriented and possesses a strategic mindset with the ability to have a holistic view. Competent in formulating supplier negotiation strategies to address commercial and contractual (includes boilerplates and KPIs/SLAs) aspects. Job_Title: Director of Trading and Portfolio Management of Energy Trading firm
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Hannah Ong Recruiter View profile & contact Director of Trading and Portfolio Management of Energy Trading firm Director of Trading and Portfolio Management of Energy Trading firm - Exp gained as an electricity trader or portfolio manager is useful - You have knowledge and experience in crafting hourly curves with strong data analysis, price analytics, trading and hedging experience. - Knowledge of the electricity market is a must The co is a start-up in the Singapore energy world, with a mission to transform the energy market, starting with 100% clean and renewable energy in Singapore. It has a mission to switch as many people as possible to clean, renewable energy. They do this by making clean energy as cheap as dirty energy using the latest and smartest technology available.  It uses state of the art technology that helps them distinguish themselves from other utility providers. As the Director of Trading and Portfolio Management, you will be part of the executive team .You will be closely working with the CEO, CCO and CFO in the team. The co manages a portfolio of ~50GWh in monthly contracted supply, ranging from smaller shops to large manufacturing multinationals. Main job functions: -      responsible managing the daily P&L; -      responsible for managing the pricing towards our end customers; -      responsible for hedging and trading our positions; -      setup efficient reporting to the board and other stakeholders, ensuring timely and correct insights into the commodity business; -      together with a small team, take our mission as inspiration, use the firm’s strategy as a compass, and own the company & team goals as a clear short term target; -      develop a vision and strategy for the trading, pricing and portfolio; -      challenge your team to go beyond themselves in reaching joint ambitions; -      responsible for the development, implementation and operation of advanced predictive analytics techniques by the team, that deliver high added value to the organization; -      responsible for establishing a data-driven culture and mindset in your team; -      maintain and improve our financial models for scenario analysis, forecasting and liquidity management; -      setup prudent Risk Management and look for potential beneficial counter parties; -      responsible for designing and implementation of relevant (IT) processes; -      try to take part in relevant commissions as representative for Flo What is your profile? -      completed relevant education, a relevant (energy) technical/finance education is a strong advantage; -      has very relevant experience in the energy market. You have preferably have been an electricity trader or portfolio manager in your previous job; - You have knowledge and experience in crafting hourly curves; - Knowledge of the electricity market is a must - You have at least 5-7 years of work experience in a similar (managerial) position with strong data analysis, price analytics, trading and hedging experience. -      You have an overview; you know how to prioritize and you are decisive; -      You are pragmatic and easily make connections between departments, projects and activities; -      You are a strong leader and project manager with a clear vision on IT and Business Processes; -      Knowledge of gas markets and the Australian markets is an advantage but not a must - You are very skillful in SQL (Postgress) and Excel . Afinity with Python and R is an added quality that is taken into consideration as a strong advantage; -      You feel at home in a young and dynamic organization with ambitious growth targets; -      You have demonstrable affinity with the firm’s sustainable mission What do we offer? -      A challenging start up position with which you can make an impact; -      A lot of freedom and an important role in the team; -      Good salary and career opportunities; -      Working in a young and ambitious team which is entrepreneurial and dynamic To apply, pl send your cv in word doc to resume@cap-cg.com . Pl also include details on your current salary, expected salary and notice period in your cv. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Skills & Qualifications The successive candidate will need to demonstrate a selection of the following: Strong computing and programming skills.  The application stack has a C++ core with extensive of Python. Solid experience of infrastructure and database technologies such as MySQL, Oracle, Redis, RMDS. Relevant education such as an MSc/PhD in a subject such as Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Maths, or Finance. The ability to communicate effectively within a team and across multiple teams and functions. Able to multi-task different projects and prioritise against tight deadlines. Experience of the above within banking or finance and an understanding of cash and derivatives financial products. Additional Job Description Details of the Division and Team: Group Strat Analytics builds applications that solve quantitative problems. The group’s key delivery, a project known as Kannon, is to provide a step-change improvement in the quality of Risk and PnL analysis across many functions including Rates and Credit Trading, Treasury and the Transaction Bank. This is being achieved by providing best-in-class applications and libraries for both live trading as well as end-of-day analysis. It has been funded as a Core Change Initiative at the heart of the DB’s Simplification Strategy. The design, specification and implementation of Kannon is by Strats in close partnership with Trading & Sales, Methodology, Technology and Support groups. The application covers risk analysis and live pricing tools as well as E-Trading analytics. This includes batch, real-time and desktop processing using a single cohesive architecture. The consistency in analytics and the technology platform ensures that no arbitrage can exist between various parts of the Bank as well as rational allocation of constrained resources, including risk budget, balance sheet, funding, and capital. The Platform Engineering team is responsible for the tooling that underpins multiple aspects of the Strats projects including delivering SDLC tools, Test Automation and Monitoring as well as Reference Data management and Grid compute orchestration. It also works with DB Technology groups to provision hardware estate and Control functions to address Regulation and Policy adherence. Your key responsibilities: You will be joining the Platform Engineering team to improve the processes that underpin its successful operation Design and implementation of the deployment of key infrastructure components such as database or compiler upgrades. Maintenance of high-performance applications deployed across multiple locations. Improving the stability of the development and production environments. Support development teams with infrastructure queries. Share in the support rota supporting the practical use of the application in the production environment. Your skills and experience: The successive candidate will need to demonstrate a selection of the following skills: Track record of developing or supporting large applications running on Unix platforms. 2 years or more of experience with Python production level development, including experience with Numpy and Panda. 5 years or more of experience with each of: Bash script development of ancillary processes that support functions such as scheduling, backups, reporting and monitoring. C++ working on interfacing application libraries to databases or other remote sources such as MariaDB or Redis. Maintaining and implementing CI tool chaining on Team-city /Jenkins or other CI environments. Ability to communicate effectively within a technical team and across multiple teams and functions. Able to multi-task different projects and prioritize against tight deadlines.

UX Research Manager Introduction to the role: Our client is seeking a UX Researcher that is a creative problem solver, enjoys working on early stage products and has a passion for conducting research that will impact a wide audience. This is a newly created role with a global tech MNC that is growing rapidly. The ideal candidate will work cross functionally with other teams and rely on both qualitative and quantitative research to make informed decisions. Responsibilities: • Autonomously manage and run multiple research projects with various complexities, from tactical to strategic research • Build and execute research roadmaps, utilise a variety of methods to develop and innovate on user research practice. • Communicate and deliver meaningful research insights to different stakeholders. • Collaborate with other business units in the research process to build innovative products. • You will be a key player of a user-driven culture and have an impact on the decision of stakeholders. Desired Qualifications/Certifications: • More than 6 years in a UX research related role • Need to have strong planning skills as you help drive research roadmap, plan, and execute a variety of studies independently - interviews, tests, surveys, workshops, etc. • Being able to prioritise - being able to deliver high-value research in a fast and changing environment and meeting deadlines. • Being able to provide toolbox and lead the process of putting UX guidance in place and be able to intertwine qualitative and quantitative research. • Pursued higher education in Psychology, Sociology or a related field. • Able to Understand human behaviour and translating qualitative data into deep, meaningful insights. • Strong problem solving and analytical abilities. • Results and impact-focused, keeping an eye on the overall outcome and desired impact. • Fluent in English and have excellent written and verbal communication skills. • Team player who is involved and can motivate and empower team members. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified / contacted. Job_Title: Client Due Diligence Remediation Specialist, COO SG (Associate/Senior Associate)
Job_Descriptions: Client Due Diligence Remediation Specialist, COO SG (Associate/Senior Associate) At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! This position within the Singapore COO team is responsible for supporting our Front Office in a multi-year program to uplift the standards of the CDD write-up and documentation for our existing clients. The successful candidate is expected to be knowledgeable in CDD/AML principles to be able to analyse and identify gaps and risks in the existing KYC and Source of Wealth (SoW) information, and to be able to work well within a team while taking initiative and ownership over his/her own area of work. Main Duties Accurately identify gaps (if any) in client's source of wealth and assess the plausibility in line with MAS and the Bank's expectations. Perform detailed calculations to support the client's source of wealth journey, i.e accumulation of wealth over time. Liaise with relationship managers for deficiencies of KYC information and obtain corroboration documentation. Assist relationship managers to succinctly translate the SoW information into a professional and quality write up. Report to the SoW remediation team lead for completion progress on a regular basis and escalate issues to Business Compliance Managers or Compliance where required Coordination and collation of CDD related MIS. Qualifications Work Experience Requirements At least 4 - 8 years of experience in AML and Source of Wealth (SoW) experience for Client Onboarding and Periodic Reviews in a private banking environment. Knowledgeable and sensitive to the risks involved AML risks of private banking clients. Strong analytical writing skills and strong communication skills, including the ability to deal with potentially contentious issues effectively. Familiar with excel and preparation of statistics for reporting. Education Requirements Diploma/ Degree holder ACAMs or ICA would be preferred

About Iris We’re Iris. We’re For the Forward. A creative, strategy and innovation company that uses the power of participation to excite progress for businesses. We’re inviting you to participate in progress – moving yourself and the world forward with every decision you make. Our office Our bustling office in the business district of Singapore proudly embodies the best of Iris within the APAC region. Home to an eclectic team of 60 with deep specialisms, we are proud to be the creative agency of record for FairPrice, Samsung, Philips and other leading brands in the region. What are we looking for? A Talent Advisor to join our People team! You’ll own the recruitment of all junior – mid roles as well as ensuring seamless Talent processes, and a For the Forward candidate experience. You’ll also support the busy People team. Your key focuses will be to: Work collaboratively with hiring managers, making sure to meet relevant hiring managers to understand their needs Own the end-to-end recruitment process (including candidate sourcing) for junior to mid level hires, making sure you’re on top of all candidates in the process and ensure a For the Forward experience Arrange, coordinate, and manage all interviews; diarise and coordinate the day-to-days and keep everyone up to date and on time Be future focussed, look for new sourcing methods, ways to advertise, and attract key talent in the market Ensure candidate experience is key – be approachable, diligent, and enthused by our candidates having wonderful experiences, regardless of the outcome Ensure comprehensive People & Talent administration including preparing contracts, contract changes, uploading various candidate documents to BambooHR and updating resource documents Manage immigration queries and MOM visa processes; ensuring we keep accurate records of employee eligibility to work in Singapore Ensure you keep comprehensive reports so that you have data that enables us to provide accurate reports on employee data, including but not limited to interviews, time- to-hire, cost per hire, etc. Give feedback to candidates in a timely manner – ensuring that they are an advocate of Iris even though they’re not successful Who are you? Have experience in recruitment, preferably with end-to-end recruitment and in- house experience Desire to build a career within an in-house recruitment function/HR team and to provide brilliant candidate experience Strong attention to detail and an effective problem solver Ability to work in a fast paced and creative environment Ability to manage time, multitask, and juggle priorities Confident, collaborative, and curious Strong interpersonal, influencing and communication (written and verbal) skills A team player Passion for marketing and the creative industry Who are we? The Iris Character We have five core behaviours that we look for to help us to build a culture that fosters true progress: Courage, Storytelling, Collaboration, Empathy and Commitment. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer and recruit on talent alone, regardless of age, ethnicity, religion, education, class, sexual orientation or disability. We champion diversity and believe it not only benefits but enhances our creativity, our company and society at large. We are For the Forward. ‘For the Free’ is our global DE&I strategy. Its aim is to create a business where everyone feels free to be themselves and has the same opportunity and access to progress. Our DE&I strategy encourages courageous thinkers who champion outsider perspectives. ‘For the Free’ has three main pillars of activity: Diversity - We want to invite difference. To be an organisation that is fully representative of different groups and reflects the city, country and world that we live in. We value our talents’ lived experiences – including gender, race, class, disability, neuro-diversity and sexual orientation. Equity - We want to be fair to everyone. To remove barriers for individuals and groups and provide the bespoke access, support and opportunities that are needed to fully participate in our organisation. We are levelling the playing field. Inclusion - We want everyone to feel at home. To provide a place where people can be themselves, express their unique identity and contribute to the life of our community. If this interests, you then we want you! Send us your CV and we’ll get in touch.
